Multiple Imputation and running mixed effect regression

mi_lmer.Rd

Multiple imputation with lmer

mi_lmer(x, y)

Arguments

x

nxp input design matrix. It should not include intercept.
y

qxn outcome matrix.

Value

tmaps t-values for each coefficients

df Degree of freedome of each coefficients

Details

This function computes mixed effect regression after voxel-wise multiple imputation.

Examples

library(neurorct)
m.dim=c(20,30,40)
y.base=y.fu=array(0,c(dim(a),npergroup*2))
#> Error in array(0, c(dim(a), npergroup * 2)): object 'a' not found
eff.d=0.8
npergroup=30
for (j in 1:(npergroup*2)){
set.seed(j)
y.base[,,,j]<-array(rnorm(m.dim[1]*m.dim[2]*m.dim[3]),dim=m.dim)
tmp2<-0.5*perturb*array(rnorm(m.dim[1]*m.dim[2]*m.dim[3]),dim=m.dim)
if (j<npergroup){tmp2[10:13,15:17,20:22]<-tmp2[10:13,15:17,20:22]+eff.d}
y.fu[,,,j]<-tmp2
}
#> Error in y.base[, , , j] <- array(rnorm(m.dim[1] * m.dim[2] * m.dim[3]),     dim = m.dim): object 'y.base' not found
